replyComment: Not going to pay to watch the movie. That also means not buying the Bluray version when it finally comes too.  I will watch the movie for free in some other ways and WB only got themselves to blame. I think WB shouldn't keep her on, especially as she has stolen from sick children (the children's hospital), something that I wish was a joke. Sorry, you support a woman that do those kinds of things and more,  you can forget receiving my money.  Oh yes, I am not a johnny Depp fan. I'm just a person that followed the case, read all the statements, realised all the things she has done and became horrified at how she affected everyone. Cannot support a company that immorally stand by and support a person like her.
They've got so much bad publicity now!
Yes, that was what we were told by Heard's publicists and sources close to the project. So, she'll still be in the movie as Mera.
